creditline: Gift of the collection of Mari and Irving Lipton
description: rectangular form on the diagonal with three round drawers with concave textured front panels; rectangle has two organic tendrils, one extending from each small end, terminating in organic pad-like feet; drawers lined with black felt; inscriptions on back panels of drawers
inscription:
Signature, Date and Inscription

on back panel of top drawer, incised: [...and a tree stands tall above for having roots planted firmly below....]; on back panel of middle drawer, incised: [...and a stream gains strength by yielding...]; on back panel of bottom drawer, incised: [...knowing how much is enough....]
medium: East Indian rosewood, Burmese padouk, curly imbuia, felt
signed: on bottom, incised: [(obscured by sticker) legs at 45 o / 1981 / M. Graham / wood: legs  eastern indian rosewood / body  burmese padouk / drawer  curly imbuia]
title: Box
